meanings.definition: To shorten a word by omitting one or more sounds or letters.
meanings.sent1: She apocopated the long word to make it easier to spell.
meanings.sent2: The editor apocopated the article to fit the word limit.
meanings.sent3: The teacher apocopated the assignment instructions for a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: His excitement apocopated his speech, making it hard to understand.
meanings.sent5: The chef apocopated the recipe, simplifying it for beginners.

meanings.definition: Having a word or phrase with the last sound or syllable omitted.
meanings.sent2: The apocopated phrase left listeners curious about the missing part.
meanings.sent3: The apocopated song ending left the audience wanting more.
meanings.sent4: Her apocopated name made it hard to remember.
meanings.sent5: The apocopated title hinted at a mysterious story.
